getStationFromParams

Station getStationFromParams(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> params)
                             throws java.sql.SQLException
Retrieves a Station from a parameter map. Parameters supported are stationId, id (can be wban, coop, or goes), and state/location/vector. A unique station is expected to be found, and an exception will be thrown if multiple stations are retrieved.
    List of possible params, note that Lists can also be provided as arrays
  • "stationId" Integer stationId
  • "id" String coop, wban, or goes id
  • "state" String 2-letter state abbreviation
  • "location" String city name, e.g. Los Cruces
  • "vector" String length+directional, e.g. "8 SW"

Parameters:
params - Map of parameters the query should meet
Returns:
Station which meets these parameters or null if nothing retrieved
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - If an error occurs

getStationsFromParams

java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,Station> getStationsFromParams(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> params)
                                                               throws java.sql.SQLException
Retrieves a Map of stations with PORs from a parameter map. Parameters supported are stationId(s), networkId(s), id (can be wban, coop, or goes), state(s) (must be 2-letter abbr.), visible (true). A single stationId may be passed as "stationId" or a list of stationIds may be passed as "stationIds", but not both; the same holds true for networkId and state. Multiple parameters may otherwise be passed (such as a list of states and nontestStations=true), and stations which meet all parameters will be returned.
    List of possible params, note that Lists can also be provided as arrays
  • "stationId" Integer stationId
  • "stationIds" List of stationIds
  • "id" String coop, wban, or goes id
  • "ids" List of coop, wban, or goes ids
  • "networkId" Integer networkId
  • "networkIds" List of networkIds
  • "network" String [crnonly|hcnmonly]
  • "crnreps" Boolean true to include representative CRN stations in HCNM network; must be used in conjunction with network=hcnmonly
  • "states" List 2-letter state abbreviations
  • "state" String 2-letter state abbreviation
  • "location" String city name, e.g. Los Cruces
  • "vector" String length+directional, e.g. "8 SW"
  • "nontestStations" Boolean true to exclude test stations (removing from use in favor of "visible")
  • "visible" Boolean true to exclude test and abandoned stations
  • "commissioned" Boolean true to include only stations are currently commmissioned
  • "commdate" String yyyymmdd only stations which were commmissioned on a certain date
  • "closed" Boolean true to include only stations currently with a commcode of "closed"
  • "porstart" String yyyymmdd only stations which have PORs beginning after a certain date

Parameters:
params - Map of parameters the query should meet
Returns:
Map of stations which meet these parameters
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - If an error occurs

getStation

Station getStation(int stationId)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
Retrieves the Station with this stationId, or null if none is found. Permits the retrieval of a station with no POR.

Parameters:
stationId - The stationId of a station in the database
Returns:
Station with this stationId
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - If an error occurs

getLastModForStation

java.lang.String getLastModForStation(int stationId,
                                      int begin,
                                      int end)
                                      throws java.sql.SQLException
Retrieves the last time an observation was modified for a station between two datetimes.

Parameters:
stationId - The id of the station
begin - The earliest datetime to consider
end - The last datetime to consider
Returns:
A String representing the last modification time in YYYYMMDDHH24MI
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - If an error occurs

stationFromIdentifier

@Deprecated
Station stationFromIdentifier(java.lang.String id)
                              throws java.sql.SQLException
Deprecated. use StationService.stationFromIdentifier(String) instead (5/9/11)

Retrieves a station from any identifier: station_id, wbanno, coopno; must use a unique identifier. Permits the retrieval of a station with no POR.

Parameters:
id - The identifier of the station
Returns:
a Station fitting the identifier
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - If an error occurs

stationFromAtddno

                          throws java.sql.SQLException
Deprecated. use StationService.stationFromAtddno(String) instead (5/9/11)

Retrieves a station from atddno. Permits the retrieval of a station with no POR. NOTE: Can't uniquely add atddno to stationFromIdentifier method, because there is overlap between stationId and atddno.

Parameters:
atddno - The atddno of the station
Returns:
a Station with this atddno
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - If an error occurs

stationFromName

@Deprecated
Station stationFromName(java.lang.String state,
                                   java.lang.String location,
                                   java.lang.String vector)
                        throws java.sql.SQLException
Deprecated. use StationService.stationFromName(String,String,String) instead (5/9/11)

Retrieves a station from its unique state-location-vector (eg "AL", "Gadsden", "19 N"). Permits the retrieval of a station with no POR.

Parameters:
state - eg "AL"
location - eg "Gadsden"
vector - eg "19 N"
Returns:
the Station at state+location+vector
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - If an error occurs
